class_notes: (This course will introduce students to major works of British literature - including poetry, drama, and prose - dating roughly from the death of Elizabeth in 1603 to the restoration of the monarchy in 1660. We will adopt a broadly historicist approach, devoting special attention to the relation between the period's literature and the politics of the English Civil War (1642-1651). This approach, however, will not be at the expense of attention to the formal and thematic qualities of individual works. Areas and themes covered in the course will include metaphysical and cavalier Poetry, Jacobean drama, gender relations in the seventeenth century, empiricism and science, the English Civil War, and the poetry of John Milton.)
course_description: Selected works of early to mid-seventeenth century literature, with an emphasis on the poetry of Donne, Herbert, Crashaw, Jonson, Herrick, Vaughan, and Marvell.
